name: Gangadine Cocktail
note: Oxygenée is a white Absinthe made in Belgium.

name: Gibson
instruction: Stir, strain into a cocktail glass, and garnish with a pearl onion on a stick.

name: Gazette Cocktail
instruction: Serve in a wineglass with a whole slice of Lemon.
note: Recipe by Wm. Reno, Freerstone Café, Toledo, Ohio.

name: Gilroy Cocktail
instruction: Shake well and strain into a cocktail glass.

name: Gimlet
instruction: Stir well. Can be iced if desired.

name: Gin Cocktail
instruction: Shake well and serve with a Cherry.

name: Gin Fizz
instruction: Shake well, strain into medium-sized tumbler, and fill with Soda Water.

name: Gin Highball
instruction: Gin and Soda, with Lemon Peel squeezed in glass and a lump of Ice.

name: Gin Julep
note: Prepared the same way as Mint Julep.

name: Gin Rickey
instruction: Squeeze lime juice into a glass with ice, add gin, and fill with seltzer or soda water.

name: Golden Glow
instruction: Shake with ice, strain into a glass with a blob of grenadine at the bottom.
note: Specialty of New Hotel Jefferson, St-Louis, U.S.A.

name: Gin Sling
instruction: Shake well and strain into a medium-sized tumbler.

name: Gin Smash
note: Prepared the same way as a Brandy Smash.

name: Ginger Beauty Cocktail
note: Recipe by Robert Muet, New York Bar, Paris.

name: Gloom Chaser Cocktail
instruction: Shake well and strain into a cocktail glass.
note: Recipe by "Charlie," Ermitage, Champs Elysées, Paris.

name: Golden Fizz
note: Similar to Gin Fizz, but with the yolk of a fresh egg added.

name: Golden Slipper
ingredients: 1/2 glass Eau de Vie de Dantzig
note: Recipe by Harry Johnson, New Orleans.

name: "Goodwill" Cocktail
note: Recipe by W. H. Taylor, Cafe Royal, London. Second Prize, British Empire Cocktail Competition, 1936.

name: Gradient Cocktail
note: Recipe by Otto, Henry's Hotel Bar, Paris.

name: Gray Bar Cocktail
note: Recipe by S. Kudner, New York.

name: Green Room Cocktail
instruction: Shake well and strain into a cocktail glass.

name: Guards' Cocktail
instruction: Shake well and strain into a cocktail glass.
